channel.title: RuneScape map viewer
channel.description:
Hello, I'm new here and would just like to ask if anyone could help me modify the RuneScape mapview applet... I had tried decompiling it once and found some interesting things (interesting to me because I like maps, not "OMG NEW DISCOVERY WE HAX RUNESCAPE!!111")...
http://www.runescape.com/worldmap/worldmap.main.js5 [url=http://www.runescape.com/worldmap/worldmap.dungeon.js5]http://www.runescape.com/worldmap/worldmap.[b]dungeon[/b].js5[/url] [url=http://www.runescape.com/worldmap/worldmap.extra.js5]http://www.runescape.com/worldmap/worldmap.[b]extra[/b].js5[/url]
This is particularly interesting to me because I'd like to check out what the "dungeon" and "extra" contain, and also if we could dump it to a PNG/BMP/any lossless or uncompressed image format (what format does Jagex use for the world map file anyways?).
Thanks!
PS - Please let me know if I've done anything wrong here and if so I apologize.

item.title: RuneScape map viewer
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:7, topic:165847”][quote author=sh!ft link=topic=224933.msg1939668#msg1939668 date=1198060483]
There’s a dump function in it already… A guy named Nick Stallman had help from some jackass named pplsuqbawlz and dumped a modified versions of the map and charged a few dollars for it on some scam site of his.
[/quote]
too bad nick never charged any money for it.
http://www.runescape-map.org/

he used the map files (saved as pngs) and created a dynamic zoom world map (lost the url)
get your facts straight[/quote]sh!ft is psb, thats why he is a moron

Read full topic

There’s a dump function in it already… A guy named Nick Stallman had help from some jackass named pplsuqbawlz and dumped a modified versions of the map and charged a few dollars for it on some scam site of his.

too bad nick never charged any money for it.
http://www.runescape-map.org/

he used the map files (saved as pngs) and created a dynamic zoom world map (lost the url)
get your facts straight

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape map viewer
item.dc:creator: @sh_ft sh!ft
item.description:
@sh_ft wrote:

[quote=“Shadowland, post:4, topic:165847”]Any tips or instructions on how I would go about doing that? Like I said, I’m new to this decompiling and deobfuscating stuff.

I do do programming though so I won’t be as idiotic as some of the people I’ve seen here, I just need some help with this.

Rite clik and hit view sourse then u can rescript the runescape code to hak it?

That is my favorite so far. :)[/quote]

Well, if you’re running linux, get some freeware like kompare or kdiff or windows ExamDiff and use cfparse or BCEL to dump the bytecode, and examine how the patterns arise from the control field. Since you’re in programming, reversing should come naturally, unless of course this is a lie. Edit: Sorry, I’m a skeptic.

Oh, bytecode 101: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jvms/second_edition/html/VMSpecTOC.doc.html

The bytecode really hasn’t changed since 1.2, the only differences are new attributes that allow newer jvm’s to do newer things, like the stackmap and annotations what not.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape map viewer
item.dc:creator: @Shadowland Shadowland
item.description:
@Shadowland wrote:

Any tips or instructions on how I would go about doing that? Like I said, I’m new to this decompiling and deobfuscating stuff.

I do do programming though so I won’t be as idiotic as some of the people I’ve seen here, I just need some help with this.

Rite clik and hit view sourse then u can rescript the runescape code to hak it?

That is my favorite so far.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape map viewer
item.dc:creator: @sh_ft sh!ft
item.description:
@sh_ft wrote:

[quote=“Shadowland, post:1, topic:165847”]Hello, I’m new here and would just like to ask if anyone could help me modify the RuneScape mapview applet… I had tried decompiling it once and found some interesting things (interesting to me because I like maps, not “OMG NEW DISCOVERY WE HAX RUNESCAPE!!111”)…

http://www.runescape.com/worldmap/worldmap.main.js5
http://www.runescape.com/worldmap/worldmap.dungeon.js5
http://www.runescape.com/worldmap/worldmap.extra.js5

This is particularly interesting to me because I’d like to check out what the “dungeon” and “extra” contain, and also if we could dump it to a PNG/BMP/any lossless or uncompressed image format (what format does Jagex use for the world map file anyways?).

Thanks!

PS - Please let me know if I’ve done anything wrong here and if so I apologize.[/quote]

There’s a dump function in it already… A guy named Nick Stallman had help from some jackass named pplsuqbawlz and dumped a modified versions of the map and charged a few dollars for it on some scam site of his.

In any case, the function already exists in the code as far as I saw, it dumps to png.

It seems it’s obfuscated just the same way the client is… A flow control field added by ZKM which can be removed with ease… Try finding Saveon’s deobber and make a new control field finder for the map applets, decompile with jode, and have at it.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape map viewer
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Dungeon would be the map of underground dungeons, and extra would likely be other places on the map not covered by the normal map, (prehaps second floors of buildings and stuff). In order to dump the map, you’d need to figure out how the applet reads and displays the map, because it’s not stored in any common format. Doubtless another one of Jagex’s proprietary ones.
No, you certainly didn’t do anything wrong.

Read full topic
